BVR kill chain: CTOL 5th-gen with AN/APG-81 AESA radar (200+ km detection), sensor fusion, and internal 4 AIM-120D/AAM-4B bays for stealthy BVR; EOTS-2 targeting and MADL/Link-16 enable cooperative kills with E-767 cueing to 160 km envelope; 42 operational across 3 squadrons (Komatsu, Misawa, etc.), with 105 more on order toward 147 total. BVR kill chain: Upgraded 4.5-gen with AN/APG-82(V)1 AESA (250 km range), thrust-vectoring, and 8-12 AIM-120D pylons for high-volume BVR; J-MSIP mods add conformal tanks and datalink for sustained ops; dual-seat trainers with identical capabilities; core interceptor fleet across 10+ squadrons, integrated with FPS-5 radars for 160 km effective range. Associated products: AN/APG-82(V)1 AESA, AIM-120D AMRAAM, conformal tanks

BVR kill chain: Enlarged F-16 derivative with J/APG-1 AESA (150 km), fly-by-wire, and 6 AIM-120C-7/AAM-4B missiles; excels in maritime strike/BVR with conformal loads; tandem-seat trainers with identical radar for tactics; indigenous production by Mitsubishi, forming 4 squadrons for forward defense, supports networked cueing via E-2D for 130 km engagements. BVR kill chain: Carrier-incompatible but land-based AEW with APS-145 radar (400 km) and CEC for cooperative BVR; 4 E-2C upgraded to D standard by 2025, plus 9 new-builds IOC; No. 31st Sqdn provides persistent coverage for Typhoon Strait.
